citeinfo.origin: Bureau of Land Management, Colorado State Office, Geosciences Team, Dave Taylor (ed.)
citeinfo.title: ilmcoedt.ILMCODBO.co_lst_conflated_poly

serinfo.sername: BLM Colorado State Wide Geospatial Database
serinfo.issue: lst24k_100k = The name of the ArcInfo "coverage" (post export) covered in this metadata file.

descript.abstract:
The original data set consisted of a merge of 56 Colorado 1:100,000 scale land ownership maps that were digitized at the FWS. The hard copy maps/source materials were provided to the FWS by the BLM Colorado State Office. Data was originally obtained by the BLM is USGS DLG format. Individual quads were imported into the Automated Digitizing System (ADS) and reattributed using the most current source material at the time of conversion. Time was around 1994. At this time the BLM Colorado State Office was still on the Prime computers and this was where the data set resided in a converted MOSS format. MOSS files were then converted to UNIX Arc Info and merged into this data set.
Data were then integrated with 1:24,000 scale land ownership data that were gathered from BLM Colorado field offices through out the state where available. Data set now is a mix of scale, tolerances, and vintage, ranging from 1994 to 2006, line work ranging from GCDB to 24K to 100K map scale/land grid source. See "progress reports" in this metadata for more information on this subject. Also see "attribute section" for explaination of line work accuracy/vintage.
descript.purpose: To illustrate Land Ownership in Colorado in a digital form for map display and query.
descript.supplinf:
Edge tie errors may exsist. These edge ties concerns can only be resolved by the respective land management agencies (primarily the Bureau of Land Management). Data entry staff at the National Ecology Research Center have exceeded standard digitizing expectations by contacting many outside sources in attempts to resolve discrepancies in the paper maps. There are areas where the digital data do not match the paper maps because of more accurate information obtained from outside sources. If you have any concerns about differences between the digital and paper maps contact the Bureau of Land Management, Colorado State Office.
Historical Note: Data edge tie errors were not resolved while inserting the (more accurate) 24K data into the (less accurate) 100K. However the data should display just fine and the polygon to label point distribution is correct. Be aware of the little offsets (in the arcs) between the field data (more accurate) and the complete statewide land ownership (less accurate) coverage polygons. You can identify these arcs by selecting the arcs that have no attributes associated with them in the .aat feature attribute table info file.
Historical Claiification Note (as of July 2006): Data set has now been through many updates and format changes. The editing/update version of the data is now maintained in ArcSDE/Informix database format. Once editing is complete for a particular update session the data is exported to shape file format and served to general users and the public in that manner. Lines and Polygons are maintained in a ArcGIS geodatabase format with topology rules and domains. Line work has feature level metadata attached to it so the user of the data can determine the source and accuracy of the boundaries. Data was snapped to BLMs statewide GCDB survey grid on or about Oct. 2005. Line work that have blank attribute values are assumed to be snapped to this vintage of GCDB. As update cycles continue Line work will have populated attribute values that indicate the source and accuracy if that boundary. GCDB survey lines move and may have not existed at the time of snapping. As GCDB improves through time and this land ownership layer is updated to reflect those changes, the data will be more accurate. Lastly while working with this data set it has come to our attention that other land types such as forest service boundaries, private land, state lands, etc. may be missing or misplaced. The BLM lands are the most accurate in this layer at this time but even those lands have some problems. Be sure to read the process steps to see where we are at in the update quality control process.

idinfo.useconst: Any hardcopies utilizing these data sets shall clearly indicate their source. If the licensee has modified the data in any way they are obligated to describe the types of modifications they have performed on the hardcopy map. Licensee specifically agrees not to misrepresent these data sets, nor to imply that changes they made were approved by the Bureau of Land Management.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

citeinfo.origin: United States Department of the Interior, Fish and Wildlife Service, National Ecology Research Center in cooperation with the Bureau of Land Management, Colorado State Office, Geosciences Team.
citeinfo.title: Statewide Land Status Map (GCDB, 24k, 100k) version

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy is tested by manual comparisons of the source with hard copy plots and/or symbolized display of the Land Status on a interactive computer graphic system. Data was also compared to Master Title Plats and survey notes at the Bureau of Land Management.

dataqual.logic: Polygon and Arc-Node topology present. Coverage checked and passed for topology errors.
dataqual.complete:
Data completeness for this data set reflects the content of the source graphic, MTPs, conversations with other land agencies, and survey notes. Features may have been eliminated or generalized on the source graphic due to scale and legibility constraints. Below is the original list of 100k Quads digitized for this project along with the Source date of the source material. Also listed are the dates, file names and descriptive name details of the field data inserted into this statewide coverage.

horizpa.horizpar: Referenced to USGS base map; however, does not register perfectly, because data were digitized off of paper quadrangle. In some cases data is referenced to GCDB Land Grid Published by BLM.

srcinfo.typesrc: Paper USGS quads and Geographic Coordinate Data Base (GCDB)

procstep.procdesc:
Original coverage were "lst100k" (see metadata on this coverage for process steps to this point). Editor for this coverage used BLM field office land ownership data and used the "erase" command with the "net" option in ArcInfo to create holes in the original data. Editor then used "mapjoin" with the "net" option to join the field office data to the statewide data. Editor then used the "dissolve" command with the "net" option to dissolve arcs between common attributed polygons.
Attribute schema had to be modified in the polygon table so land ownership attributes would have the same field names, field definitions, and attribute names.
Final coverage is a combination of many different BLM field office sources. The arc table were modified to maintain a feature base accuracy source attribute for each of the arcs in the final coverage.

Data converted from ArcInfo coverage to ArcSDE 8.3 Geodatabase. Domain values added for polygon data and arcs. Topology Rules set in the geodatabase and data was validated. Update editing continued in the SDE environment.
During the editing and update cycle the editor keeped track of the boundaries by attributing the arcs with line source/feature level metadata. Topology rules were set so if a polygon boundary moved the arc moved with it. Also during this update cycle the editor incorporated many state land board features on a statewide bases.

Data was froze during this time period, and handed over to a private contractor. The contarctor was tasked to conflate the data to BLM's Geographic Coordinate Data Base (GCDB). Because of the difficulty of maintaining topology movement between the arcs and the polygons the contractor did not maintain the feature level metadata for the arcs.
Contractor provided the data back to BLM Colorado with polygon topology only in the form on a personal geodatabase. Data was conflated to GCDB survey grid dated 20051130

A minumum data quality check and validation from contractor, moved into a Arcinfo coverage model, build command was run on data. Data is clean to this point with no topology errors and ready to move data back into a SDE geodatabase. Data can also be exported to a shape file so it can be served to the public and other interested parties.
Attribute schema for polygons and lines were re-evaluated and changed to reflect national standards that the BLMs NILS office uses for their SMA layer.
Updates recieved from BLM Grand Junction and implemented. Anticipate some more updates for the same area in the next month or so.

Attribute values updated to reflect domain changes for CDOW State Lands. Editor found all values in the attribute table that had a value of CDW and switched those to Local/State, County, City; Wildlife, Park, and Outdoor Recreation Areas. In some cases polygons were adjusted to reflect geometery changes recieved from The State Land Board. These mostly occurred in the NW part of the State.
Be aware at the time of this posting in this process step that a statewide update of State/LOCAL Lands has not been completed and it is the feeling of this editor that there are lots of changes to geometry for these state lands classifications. We will try to incorperate more of these changes in the coming weeks. (ed; dtaylor)
Polygons updated on the default database. Database written to shape file. Updates from some field offices but not all.
Polygons updated on the default database. Database written to shape file. Updates from some field offices but not all.
Polygons updated on the default database. Database written to shape file. Updates from some field offices but not all.
Polygons updated on the default database. Database written to shape file. Updates from some field offices but not all.

Forest Service update in T 39 N, R 8 W, Sec. 6 & 7. Land Boundary snapped to 2008 GCDB Survey Lines. Forest Service update is T 36 N, R 9 W, Sec 33. Land Boundary snapped and adjusted to 2008 GCDB Survey Lines and refrenced BLM MTP.

Several updates within the BLM White River Field Office Area. Adjusted Land Boundaries to 2008 GCDB while referencing MTPs and 2008 State Wildlife Areas.
Exported SDE database to shapefile, ran check geometry, shapefile had no errors. Delete SDE Perimeter and Area fields, Added shapefile Areas, Perimeter, and Acres Fields and Populated those fields using calculator.
Several updates within the Uncompagre and Grand Junction Field Office Areas
Updated Private Land to BLM Land in and around Canyon of the Ancients National Monument.
Updates made by Grand Junction Field Office.
Updates made by Grand Junction Field Office.
Snapped to 2008 version of GCDB in the West Half of the Colorado River Valley Field Office Area (Formally the Glenwood Springs Field Office)
Many updates made from the State Office Location.
Grand Junction Field Office snapped several land boundaies to 2010 GCDB data.

Added a small piece of BLM that extends just south of the CANM per direction from the San Juan Public Lands Center in Durango, CO. This small piece of aquired BLM is for the Sand Canyon trailhead paking lot parcel.
Added several updates as directed from the BLM Canon City Field Office Reality Staff.
Several Updates from the Colorado River Valley Field Office and the Grand Junction Field Office.
Several updates in the BLM, Canon City Field Office Area.
Dataset copied.
Dataset copied.
Dataset copied.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover:
The Polygon Feature Class contains 3 user defined fields and are described below...
admin_code: Is a domain field and restricted to the following values:
BLM = Bureau of Land Management, USFS = US Forest Service, USFS_LU = US Forest Service (Bankhead Jones Land Use Lands), USFW = US Fish and Wildlife Service, BIA = Indian Reservation, LOCAL = State, County, City; Park and Outdoor Recreation Areas, SWA = State Wilderness Areas, BOR = Bureau of Reclaimation, DOD = Department of the Defense, NPS = National Park Service, PRI = Private, STA =State, OTHER = Other Federal Land, USFS_NG = US Forest Service National Grasslands
admin_manager: Is a non domain field and describes what or who manages the land. For the most part this field will be empty. If the field is empty the user of this data can assume that the manager is also the owner.
admin_name: Is a non domain field that describes the administrative name of the polygon/area if interest.
